text:
When running from the command prompt in w2000, there are two scenarios.

1)  If your TOMCAT_HOME variable ends with a windows slash (\), then the 
distribution tomcat.bat does not work because the last quote is escaped somehow.

2) If you TOMCAT_HOME variable does not end with a window dir sep, then there is 
no problem.

Solution
--------
In the tomcat.bat file, change
%_RUNJAVA% %TOMCAT_OPTS% -Dtomcat.home="%TOMCAT_HOME%" 
org.apache.tomcat.startup.Main %2 %3 %4 %5 %6 %7 %8 %9
to
%_RUNJAVA% %TOMCAT_OPTS% -Dtomcat.home=%TOMCAT_HOME% 
org.apache.tomcat.startup.Main %2 %3 %4 %5 %6 %7 %8 %9

and similar for the other run settings.

%TOMCAT_HOME% should be set here, so this should no be a problem
